00011 TTUInt32        TTAudioObject::globalSr = 44100;

00015 
00016 TTAudioObject::TTAudioObject(TTUInt8 newMaxNumChannels)
00017 {
00018         registerParameter(TT("maxNumChannels"), kTypeUInt8,             &maxNumChannels,        (TTSetterMethod)&TTAudioObject::setMaxNumChannels);
00019         registerParameter(TT("sr"),                             kTypeUInt32,    &sr,                            (TTSetterMethod)&TTAudioObject::setSr);
00020         registerParameter(TT("bypass"),                 kTypeBoolean,   &attrBypass,            (TTSetterMethod)&TTAudioObject::setBypass);
00021 
00022         // Set Defaults...
00023         setParameterValue(TT("maxNumChannels"), newMaxNumChannels);
00024         setParameterValue(TT("sr"),                             globalSr);
00025         setProcess(&TTAudioObject::bypassProcess);
00026         setParameterValue(TT("bypass"),                 kTTBoolNo);
00027 }
00028

00030 TTAudioObject::~TTAudioObject()
00031 {
00032         ;
00033 }
00034                 
00035 
00036 TTErr TTAudioObject::setMaxNumChannels(const TTValue& newValue)
00037 {
00038         maxNumChannels = newValue;
00039         sendMessage(TT("updateMaxNumChannels"));
00040         return kTTErrNone;
00041 }
00042 
00043 
00044 TTErr TTAudioObject::setSr(const TTValue& newValue)
00045 {
00046         sr = newValue;
00047         srInv = 1.0/sr;
00048         srMill = sr * 0.0001;
00049         sendMessage(TT("updateSr"));
00050         return kTTErrNone;
00051 }
00052 
00053 
00054 TTErr TTAudioObject::bypassProcess(TTAudioSignal& in, TTAudioSignal& out)
00055 {
00056         short                   vs;
00057         TTSampleValue   *inSample,
00058                                         *outSample;
00059         short                   numchannels = TTAudioSignal::getMinChannelCount(in, out);
00060         short                   channel;
00061 
00062         for(channel=0; channel<numchannels; channel++){
00063                 inSample = in.sampleVectors[channel];
00064                 outSample = out.sampleVectors[channel];
00065                 vs = in.vs;
00066 
00067                 while(vs--)
00068                         *outSample++ = *inSample++;
00069         }
00070         return kTTErrNone;
00071 }
00072 
00073 
00074 TTErr TTAudioObject::setProcess(TTProcessMethod newProcessMethod)
00075 {
00076         processMethod = newProcessMethod;
00077         if(!attrBypass)
00078                 currentProcessMethod = processMethod;
00079         return kTTErrNone;
00080 }
00081 
00082 
00083 TTErr TTAudioObject::setBypass(const TTValue& value)
00084 {
00085         attrBypass = value;
00086         if(attrBypass)
00087                 currentProcessMethod = &TTAudioObject::bypassProcess;
00088         else
00089                 currentProcessMethod = processMethod;
00090         return kTTErrNone;
00091 }
00092 
00093 
00094 TTErr TTAudioObject::process(TTAudioSignal& in, TTAudioSignal& out)
00095 {
00096         return (this->*currentProcessMethod)(in, out);
00097 }

00103 // RADIANS CONVERSIONS: cannot make static because of access to a member data element
00104 // hz-to-radians conversion
00105 TTFloat64 TTAudioObject::hertzToRadians(const TTFloat64 hz)                     // NOTE: Be sure to set the sr before calling this function
00106 {
00107         return(hz * (pi / (sr * 0.5)));
00108 }
00109 
00110 // radians-to-hz conversion
00111 TTFloat64 TTAudioObject::radiansToHertz(const TTFloat64 radians)        // NOTE: Be sure to set the sr before calling this function
00112 {
00113         return((radians * sr) / kTTTwoPi);
00114 }
00115 
00116 // degrees-to-radians conversion
00117 TTFloat64 TTAudioObject::degreesToRadians(const TTFloat64 degrees)
00118 {
00119         return((degrees * kTTPi) / 180.);
00120 }
00121 
00122 // radians-to-degrees conversion
00123 TTFloat64 TTAudioObject::radiansToDegrees(const TTFloat64 radians)
00124 {
00125         return((radians * 180.) / kTTPi);       
00126 }

00129 // Decay Time (seconds) to feedback coefficient conversion
00130 TTFloat32 TTAudioObject::decayToFeedback(const TTFloat32 decay_time, TTFloat32 delay)
00131 {
00132         TTFloat32       fb;
00133                 
00134         delay = delay * 0.001;                  // convert delay from milliseconds to seconds
00135         if(decay_time < 0){
00136                 fb = delay / -decay_time;
00137                 fb = fb * -60.;         
00138                 fb = pow(10., (fb / 20.));      
00139                 fb *= -1.;
00140         }
00141         else{
00142                 fb = delay / decay_time;
00143                 fb = fb * -60.;                         
00144                 fb = pow(10., (fb / 20.));              
00145         }               
00146         return(fb);                     
00147 }
00148 
00149 // return the decay time based on the feedback coefficient
00150 TTFloat32 TTAudioObject::feedbackToDecay(const TTFloat32 feedback, const TTFloat32 delay)
00151 {
00152         float   decay_time;
00153         
00154         if(feedback > 0){
00155                 decay_time = 20. * (log10(feedback));           
00156                 decay_time = -60.0 / decay_time;                
00157                 decay_time = decay_time * (delay);              
00158         }
00159         else if(feedback < 0){
00160                 decay_time = 20. * (log10(fabs(feedback)));             
00161                 decay_time = -60.0 / decay_time;                
00162                 decay_time = decay_time * (-delay);             
00163         }
00164         else
00165                 decay_time = 0;
00166 
00167         return(decay_time);
00168 }

00171 // ************* DECIBEL CONVERSIONS **************
00172 
00173 // Amplitude to decibels
00174 TTFloat32 TTAudioObject::linearToDb(const TTFloat32 value)
00175 {
00176         if(value >= 0) 
00177                 return(20. * (log10(value)));
00178         else
00179                 return 0;
00180 }
00181 
00182 // Decibels to amplitude
00183 TTFloat32 TTAudioObject::dbToLinear(TTFloat32 value)
00184 {
00185         return(pow(10., (value / 20.)));
00186 }

00188 
00189 // Deviate
00190 TTFloat32 TTAudioObject::deviate(TTFloat32 value)
00191 {
00192         value += (2.0 * (TTFloat32(rand()) / TTFloat32(RAND_MAX))) - 1.0;       // randomize input with +1 to -1 ms
00193         value = value * 0.001 * sr;                                                                                     // convert from ms to samples
00194         value = (TTFloat32)prime(TTUInt32(value));                                                      // find the nearest prime number (in samples)
00195         value = (value / sr) * 1000.0;                                                                          // convert back to ms
00196         
00197         return value;
00198 }
00199 
00200 // Prime
00201 TTUInt32 TTAudioObject::prime(TTUInt32 value)
00202 {
00203         long    candidate, last, i, isPrime;
00204 
00205         if(value < 2)
00206                 candidate = 2;
00207         else if(value == 2)
00208                 candidate = 3;
00209         else{
00210                 candidate = value;
00211                 if (candidate % 2 == 0)                                                         // Test only odd numbers
00212                         candidate--;
00213                 do{
00214                         isPrime = true;                                                                 // Assume glorious success
00215                         candidate += 2;                                                                 // Bump to the next number to test
00216                         last = TTUInt32(sqrt((TTFloat32)candidate));    // We'll check to see if candidate has any factors, from 2 to last
00217                         for (i=3; (i <= last) && isPrime; i+=2){                // Loop through odd numbers only
00218                                 if((candidate % i) == 0)
00219                                 isPrime = false;
00220                         }
00221                 } 
00222                 while (!isPrime);
00223         }
00224         return candidate;
00225 }
